2025-12-08.content: You can use Service Extensions to implement [dynamic forwarding](https://docs.cloud.google.com/service-extensions/docs/lb-advanced-use-cases#dynamic-forwarding), which helps you map tenants to endpoints programmatically, without having to update your URL maps. This feature is in **Preview**.

summary.title: Service Extensions with Dynamic Forwarding
summary.summary: Use Service Extensions for dynamic forwarding to programmatically map tenants to endpoints without updating URL maps. This feature is in Preview.

2025-11-17.content:
For authorization extensions, in addition to the ext\_proc Envoy gRPC API, the
[ext\_authz gRPC API](https://docs.cloud.google.com/service-extensions/docs/callouts-overview##ext-authz) is also supported. This capability allows seamless integration with the broader authorization ecosystem. This feature is in **Preview**.

summary.title: New Authorization Feature
summary.summary: The ext-authz gRPC API is now supported for authorization extensions, allowing easier integration with existing authorization systems. This feature is currently in Preview.

2025-11-13.content: [Edge extensions](https://docs.cloud.google.com/service-extensions/docs/lb-extensions-overview#edge-extensions) help you manipulate request headers early in the processing lifecycle of global external Application Load Balancers to influence caching and routing decisions. This feature is in **General Availability**.

summary.title: Edge Extensions
summary.summary: Manipulate request headers early for global external Application Load Balancers to influence caching and routing. This feature is in General Availability.

2025-11-13.content: Regional external and internal Application Load Balancers support [route](https://docs.cloud.google.com/service-extensions/docs/configure-route-extensions#configure-route-plugins) and [traffic](https://docs.cloud.google.com/service-extensions/docs/configure-traffic-extensions#configure-traffic-plugins) extensions using plugins. This feature is in **Preview**.

summary.title: Route and traffic extensions support for regional load balancers
summary.summary: Regional external and internal Application Load Balancers now support route and traffic extensions via plugins. This feature is currently in Preview.

2025-11-05.content: [Cloud Load Balancing callouts](https://docs.cloud.google.com/service-extensions/docs/callouts-overview) have full duplex streaming support.

summary.title: Cloud Load Balancing Streaming Support
summary.summary: Full duplex streaming is now supported by Cloud Load Balancing callouts.

2025-10-28.content: [Authorization extensions](https://docs.cloud.google.com/service-extensions/docs/lb-extensions-overview#authorization-extensions) help you configure Cloud Load Balancing authorization policies to use custom authorization engines. This feature is in **General Availability**.

summary.title: Authorization extensions
summary.summary: Configure Cloud Load Balancing with custom authorization engines.

2025-09-15.content: To protect AI workloads, you can [configure traffic extensions to call the Model Armor service](https://cloud.google.com/service-extensions/docs/configure-extensions-to-google-services#configure-traffic-ma) on supported Application Load Balancers. This feature is in **General Availability**.

summary.title: New Security Feature for AI Workloads
summary.summary: You can now configure traffic extensions to call the Model Armor service on supported Application Load Balancers to protect your AI workloads. This feature is in General Availability.

2025-07-24.content: To [upload your Wasm plugin code](https://cloud.google.com/service-extensions/docs/prepare-plugin-code#generic-repository) to Artifact Registry, you can use generic format repositories, in addition to Docker repositories. This feature is in **Preview**.

summary.title: New Artifact Registry support for Wasm plugins
summary.summary: Use generic format repositories to upload Wasm plugin code to Artifact Registry.

2025-07-01.content: [Plugins for Cloud Load Balancing](https://cloud.google.com/service-extensions/docs/overview#integration-lb-plugins) help you insert WebAssembly (Wasm) code in a fully managed serverless environment directly into the data path of most Cloud Load Balancing Application Load Balancers. This feature is in **General Availability**.

summary.title: New: Cloud Load Balancing Plugins
summary.summary: You can now insert WebAssembly (Wasm) code into the data path of Application Load Balancers using Plugins for Cloud Load Balancing. This feature is fully managed, serverless, and available in General Availability.

2025-06-23.content:
[Edge extensions](https://cloud.google.com/service-extensions/docs/lb-extensions-overview#edge-extensions) help you manipulate request headers early in the request processing lifecycle of global external Application Load Balancers to influence caching and routing decisions. This feature is in **Preview**.

Learn how to [configure an edge extension](https://cloud.google.com/service-extensions/docs/configure-edge-extensions).

summary.title: Feature announcement: Edge extensions
summary.summary: This feature allows you to modify request headers early in the request lifecycle for global external Application Load Balancers, helping to influence caching and routing. It is currently in Preview.
